DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of procedure or method used to collect a biospecimen or tissue sample.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The type of procedure or method used to collect the specimen

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Collected; brought together in one place.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: Collected; brought together in one place.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: The mode or manner or orderly sequence of events of a process or procedure. (from STED98)

Concepts.definition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/11/19 smt -ownership transfer from SPOREs approved by Mary Cooper.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The way a specimen or sample is collected._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fourth portion of the large intestine (colon) that communicates with the transverse colon in the left-upper quadrant of the abdomen and the rectum below.: (ko-LAHS-toe-mee) An opening into the colon from the outside of the body. A colostomy provides a new path for waste material to leave the body after part of the colon has been removed.

Concepts.definition: The fourth portion of the large intestine (colon) that communicates with the transverse colon in the left-upper quadrant of the abdomen and the rectum below.
The surgical creation of an opening between the colon and the surface of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The first part of the colon (large intestine) that starts in the right lower quadrant of the abdomen and ends at the transverse colon in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen.: (ko-LAHS-toe-mee) An opening into the colon from the outside of the body. A colostomy provides a new path for waste material to leave the body after part of the colon has been removed.

Concepts.definition: The first part of the colon (large intestine) that starts in the right lower quadrant of the abdomen and ends at the transverse colon in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen.
The surgical creation of an opening between the colon and the surface of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.::1: Upright in position or posture.::2: Surgery to remove one half of the larynx.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Upright in position or posture.
Surgery to remove one half of the larynx.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.::1: Upright in position or posture.::2: Surgery to remove one half of the larynx.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Upright in position or posture.
Surgery to remove one half of the larynx.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Gastric bypass procedure in which part of the stomach is closed off with staples, and part of the small intestine is bypassed.  This procedure is performed in severely obese patients, for permanent weight loss.

Concepts.definition: Gastric bypass procedure in which part of the stomach is closed off with staples, and part of the small intestine is bypassed.  This procedure is performed in severely obese patients, for permanent weight loss.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.::1: Surgical removal of the right part of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.
Surgical removal of the right part of the colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denoting the front surface of the body; often used to indicate the position of one structure relative to another.::1: Surgical removal of the right part of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Denoting the front surface of the body; often used to indicate the position of one structure relative to another.
Surgical removal of the right part of the colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A multi-gated acquisition (MUGA) scan and a form of radionuclide imaging that provides a comprehensive look at blood flow and the function of the lower chambers of the heart ventricles.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic test used to evaluate the pumping function of the heart's ventricles. A radioactive tracer is injected into a vein and a gamma camera detects the radiation released by the tracer, with image acquisition triggered (gated) at different points of the cardiac cycle.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Toward the middle or inside (as opposed to lateral).::1: Surgical removal of the left part of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Toward the middle or inside (as opposed to lateral).
Surgical removal of the left part of the colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Situated at or extending to the side.::1: Surgical removal of the left part of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Situated at or extending to the side.
Surgical removal of the left part of the colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure to eradicate or reduce small tumors using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of a thin needle through the skin and into a tumor, which is guided by computed tomography (CT) or ultrasound. Electrical energy delivered through this needle (electrode) heats and destroys the tumor. This therapeutic option is widely utilized by patients that have inoperable cancers, or are unsuitable chemotherapy candidates.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure to kill tissue using radiowaves to generate heat. The procedure is performed by the insertion of an electrode into a target tissue. Electrical energy delivered to the electrode heats and destroys the tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of the breast, pectoral muscles, axillary lymph nodes, and associated skin and subcutaneous tissue (from MeSH).

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, axillary lymph nodes, and pectoral muscles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the gallbladder.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the gallbladder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the vermiform appendix.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Surgical removal of the right part of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the vermiform appendix.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Surgical removal of the right part of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.: The act of gathering something together.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.

Concepts.definition: A nuclear imaging method used to evaluate pathological bone metabolism.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.7.26 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002656. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of a small sample of bone marrow (usually from the hip) through a needle for examination under a microscope to see whether cancer cells are present.

Concepts.definition: A biopsy involving the removal of a core tissue containing bone spicules and hematopoietic elements embedded in the marrow stroma.  This procedure is done in the hip area mainly for the diagnosis and evaluation of neoplastic and non-neoplastic hematopoietic disorders (e.g. anemias, leukemias, lymphomas) and the evaluation of the spread of solid tumors (e.g. carcinomas, sarcomas) and lymphomas for therapeutic purposes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Proximal; situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.: Surgical removal of part or all of the stomach.

Concepts.definition: Situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.
Surgical removal of part or all of the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Polypectomy; surgical removal of a polyp.

Concepts.definition: Complete or partial removal of a polypoid lesion from the mucosal surface.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (noo-mo-NEK-toe-mee) An operation to remove an entire lung.

Concepts.definition: The excision of part or all of a lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: (noo-mo-NEK-toe-mee) An operation to remove an entire lung.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The excision of part or all of a lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: (noo-mo-NEK-toe-mee) An operation to remove an entire lung.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The excision of part or all of a lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. mc 4.23.19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Endoscopic examination of peritoneum.

Concepts.definition: Endoscopic examination of peritoneum.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Percutaneous Route of Administration Hepatic Perfusion

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Percutaneous Route of Administration Hepatic Perfusion
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Administration through the skin.: Refers to the liver.: Bathing an organ or tissue with a fluid. In regional perfusion, a specific area of the body (usually an arm or a leg) receives high doses of anticancer drugs through a blood vessel. Such a procedure is performed to treat cancer that has not spread.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug by the way of absorption through the skin, usually for systemic action. The route allows sustained therapeutic plasma drug levels and avoids first pass effect. Simplicity of administration tends to result in high patient compliance.
Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.

The process of flooding fluid through the artery to saturate the surrounding tissue. In regional perfusion, a specific area of the body (usually an arm or a leg) is targeted and high doses of anticancer drugs are flooded through the artery to reach the surrounding tissue and kill as many cancer cells as possible. Such a procedure is performed in cases where the cancer is not thought to have spread past a localized area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial; being or affecting only a part; not total: Surgery involving the complete or partial excision of the pharynx.

Concepts.definition: Being or affecting only a part of something.
Surgery involving the complete or partial excision of the pharynx.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial; being or affecting only a part; not total: Surgical removal of the breast.

Concepts.definition: Being or affecting only a part of something.
Surgical removal of the breast.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial; being or affecting only a part; not total: Surgery to remove part or all of the larynx.

Concepts.definition: Being or affecting only a part of something.
Surgery to remove part or all of the larynx.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to completely remove the larynx.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to completely remove the larynx.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part of the pancreas, duodenum, and distal part of the bile duct.  Sometimes, the lower portion of the stomach and the gallbladder are also removed.  This procedure is performed for pancreatic, ampullary, duodenal and distal bile duct cancers.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part of the pancreas, duodenum, and distal part of the bile duct.  Sometimes, the lower portion of the stomach and the gallbladder are also removed.  This procedure is performed for pancreatic, ampullary, duodenal and distal bile duct cancers.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: Surgical removal of the pancreas. (Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Surgical removal of part or all of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The left extremity of the pancreas within the lienorenal ligament.: Surgical removal of the pancreas. (Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: The left extremity of the pancreas within the lienorenal ligament.
Surgical removal of part or all of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: That portion of the pancreas lying in the concavity of the duodenum.: Surgical removal of the pancreas. (Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: That portion of the pancreas lying in the concavity of the duodenum.
Surgical removal of part or all of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the pancreas from the point where it crosses the portal vein to the point where it enters the lienorenal ligament.: Surgical removal of the pancreas. (Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: The part of the pancreas from the point where it crosses the portal vein to the point where it enters the lienorenal ligament.
Surgical removal of part or all of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 1/25/23 added alt name for ticket number CADSR0001948 for CCTG cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial or complete resection of the omentum.

Concepts.definition: Partial or complete resection of the omentum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not provided or available.: Specified; clearly and explicitly stated.

Concepts.definition: Not provided or available.
Clearly and explicitly stated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure. (MedicineNet.com)

Concepts.definition: The region that connects the head to the rest of the body.

A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.
The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery for breast cancer in which the breast, most or all of the lymph nodes under the arm, and the lining over the chest muscles are removed. Sometimes the surgeon also removes part of the chest wall muscles.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, and the majority of the axillary lymph nodes, but sparing the pectoralis major muscle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Electromagnetic radiation between the ultrahigh frequency radio and infrared (in the 10e-3 (micro) to about 0.5 X 10e-1 meter) region of the spectrum.: Removal of a part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, electrocautery, or radiofrequency. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Electromagnetic radiation between the ultrahigh frequency radio and infrared (in the 10e-3 (micro) to about 0.5 X 10e-1 meter) region of the spectrum.
Removal, separation, detachment, extirpation, or eradication of a body part, pathway, or function by surgery, chemical destruction, morbid process, or noxious substance.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the breast.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the breast.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Surgical removal of a wedge-shaped section of lung.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Surgical removal of a wedge-shaped section of lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: many copies of or many forms: Surgical removal of a wedge-shaped section of lung.

Concepts.definition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.
Surgical removal of a wedge-shaped section of lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Surgical removal of a wedge-shaped section of lung.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Surgical removal of a wedge-shaped section of lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.: Surgical removal of a wedge-shaped section of lung.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
Surgical removal of a wedge-shaped section of lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to synch with current NCIt. mc 8.17.20

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: (lo-BEK-toe-mee) The removal of a lobe.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Surgical removal of a lobe of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: (lo-BEK-toe-mee) The removal of a lobe.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Surgical removal of a lobe of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.: (lo-BEK-toe-mee) The removal of a lobe.

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
Surgical removal of a lobe of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (lo-BEK-toe-mee) The removal of a lobe.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of a lobe of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of a wedge-shaped portion of theliver, for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: Removal of a wedge-shaped portion of theliver, for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.: Resected; having been removed by surgery.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
Having been removed by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Surgical removal of approximately half of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Surgical removal of approximately half of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Surgery to remove all or part of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Surgical removal of all or part of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Partial; being or affecting only a part; not total: Surgery to remove all or part of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Being or affecting only a part of something.
Surgical removal of all or part of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Creation of a surgical opening into the abdominal cavity.

Concepts.definition: Creation of a surgical opening into the abdominal cavity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. mc 4.23.19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (lap-a-RAHS-ko-pee) The insertion of a thin, lighted tube (called a laparoscope) through the abdominal wall to inspect the inside of the abdomen and remove tissue samples.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which part of a lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated system generated definition with current NCIt definition. mc 11/12/12

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (il-ee-AHS-toe-mee) An opening into the ileum, part of the small intestine, from the outside of the body. An ileostomy provides a new path for waste material to leave the body after part of the intestine has been removed.

Concepts.definition: Surgical creation of an external opening into the ileum for fecal diversion or drainage. Loop or tube procedures are most often employed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid.

Concepts.definition: A technique for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles suspended in a stream of fluid.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography (en-do-SKAH-pik RET-ro-grade ko-LAN-jee-o-PAN-kree-a-TAW-gra-fee). A procedure to x-ray the pancreatic duct, hepatic duct, common bile duct, duodenal papilla, and gallbladder. In this procedure, a thin, lighted tube (endoscope) is passed through the mouth and down into the first part of the small intestine (duodenum). A smaller tube (catheter) is then inserted through the endoscope into the bile and pancreatic ducts. A dye is injected through the catheter into the ducts, and an x-ray is taken.

Concepts.definition: A procedure in which the bile ducts, pancreatic duct, and gallbladder are examined using a combination of endoscopy and fluoroscopy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (en-DAHS-ko-pee) The use of a thin, lighted tube (called an endoscope) to examine the inside of the body.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A rounded mass of lymphatic tissue that is surrounded by a capsule of connective tissue. Lymph glands filter lymph (lymphatic fluid), and they store lymphocytes (white blood cells). They are located along lymphatic vessels. Also called a lymph node.: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure. (MedicineNet.com)

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.
The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (sis-TEK-toe-mee) Surgery to remove all or part of the bladder.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of the urinary bladder; or the surgical removal of a cyst..

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The third division of the colon (large intestine). It communicates with the ascending colon in the upper right-hand quadrant of the abdomen and the descending colon in the upper left-hand quadrant.: (ko-LAHS-toe-mee) An opening into the colon from the outside of the body. A colostomy provides a new path for waste material to leave the body after part of the colon has been removed.

Concepts.definition: The third division of the colon (large intestine). It communicates with the ascending colon in the upper right-hand quadrant of the abdomen and the descending colon in the upper left-hand quadrant.
The surgical creation of an opening between the colon and the surface of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the large intestine that includes the descending and sigmoid colon._Having been removed by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the large intestine that includes the descending and sigmoid colon.
Having been removed by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The proximal segment of the large intestine that is located in the right side of the abdominal cavity. It includes the cecum (with the attached appendix) and the ascending colon._Having been removed by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The proximal segment of the large intestine that is located in the right side of the abdominal cavity. It includes the cecum (with the attached appendix) and the ascending colon.
Having been removed by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the colon that connects to the descending colon above and the rectum below.: Resected; having been removed by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the colon that connects to the descending colon above and the rectum below.
Having been removed by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure involving the partial or complete resection of the sigmoid colon.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure involving the partial or complete resection of the sigmoid colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The third division of the colon (large intestine). It communicates with the ascending colon in the upper right-hand quadrant of the abdomen and the descending colon in the upper left-hand quadrant.: Resected; having been removed by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The third division of the colon (large intestine). It communicates with the ascending colon in the upper right-hand quadrant of the abdomen and the descending colon in the upper left-hand quadrant.
Having been removed by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the transverse colon.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the transverse colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A type of high-energy radiation.  In low doses, x-rays are used to diagnose diseases by making pictures of the inside of the body.  In high doses, x-rays are used to treat cancer.

Concepts.definition: Ionizing electromagnetic radiation having a wavelength that is shorter than ultraviolet radiation and longer than gamma radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others.: Removal of a wedge-shaped portion of tissue, for microscopic examinaton.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.
Removal of a wedge-shaped portion of tissue, for microscopic examinaton.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: many copies of or many forms: Removal of a wedge-shaped portion of tissue, for microscopic examinaton.

Concepts.definition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.
Removal of a wedge-shaped portion of tissue, for microscopic examinaton.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of 3D CT or MRI scans to construct a simulated visualization of patient specific organs similar or equivalent to those produced by standard endoscopic procedures.  Virtual endoscopic visualization avoids the risks associated with real endoscopy.  Additionally, there are many body regions not accessible to or compatible with real endoscopy that can be explored with virtual endoscopy. (from R. Robb presentation at Visible Human Project Conference): Endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon.

Concepts.definition: The use of 3D CT or MRI scans to construct a simulated visualization of patient specific organs similar or equivalent to those produced by standard endoscopic procedures.  Virtual endoscopic visualization avoids the risks associated with real endoscopy.  Additionally, there are many body regions not accessible to or compatible with real endoscopy that can be explored with virtual endoscopy. (from R. Robb presentation at Visible Human Project Conference)
Endoscopic examination of the luminal surface of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Endoscopic surgery of the pleural cavity performed with visualization via video transmission.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Thoracic surgery that is aided by the use of a video camera.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Endoscopic surgery of the pleural cavity performed with visualization via video transmission.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Thoracic surgery that is aided by the use of a video camera.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any endoscopic procedure that visualizes a part of the gastrointestinal tract.

Concepts.definition: Any endoscopic procedure that visualizes a part of the gastrointestinal tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz.

Concepts.definition: High frequency sound, generally with a frequency greater than 20,000 Hz.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The third division of the colon (large intestine). It communicates with the ascending colon in the upper right-hand quadrant of the abdomen and the descending colon in the upper left-hand quadrant.: Surgical removal of part or all of the colon.

Concepts.definition: The third division of the colon (large intestine). It communicates with the ascending colon in the upper right-hand quadrant of the abdomen and the descending colon in the upper left-hand quadrant.
Surgical removal of part or all of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the prostate gland. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter the prostate. Prostate tumors sometimes create echoes that are different from normal prostate tissue. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the prostate.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that uses sound waves to create a video image of the pelvic organs and tissues. A small, lubricated probe placed into the rectum releases sound waves, which create echoes as they enter a pelvic organ. The echoes that bounce back are sent to a computer that translates the pattern of echoes into a picture of the specific organ under examination.  This procedure is most often used to evaluate the prostate gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery involving the complete excision of the thyroid gland.

Concepts.definition: Surgery involving the complete excision of the thyroid gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: Surgery involving the complete or partial excision of the pharynx.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Surgery involving the complete or partial excision of the pharynx.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: Surgery involving partial or complete excision of the tongue.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Surgery involving partial or complete excision of the tongue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: Surgical removal of part or all of the stomach.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Surgical removal of part or all of the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of all of the uterus, via an abdominal approach.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of all of the uterus, via an abdominal approach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the entire colon.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the entire colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation to remove the spleen.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others.: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.
Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: many copies of or many forms: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

Concepts.definition: Having, relating to, or consisting of more than one individual, element, part, or other component; manifold.
Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

Concepts.definition: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Surgical removal of the fallopian tube(s) and ovary(ies).

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Surgical removal of the fallopian tube(s) and ovary(ies).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Surgical removal of the fallopian tube(s) and ovary(ies).

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Surgical removal of the fallopian tube(s) and ovary(ies).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Affecting both sides of the body, or a matched pair of organs.: Surgical removal of the fallopian tube(s) and ovary(ies).

Concepts.definition: Affecting both sides of the body or a matched pair of organs.
Surgical removal of the fallopian tube(s) and ovary(ies).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Surgery to remove all or part of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Surgical removal of all or part of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Surgical removal of approximately half of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Surgical removal of approximately half of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Partial; being or affecting only a part; not total: Surgery to remove all or part of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Being or affecting only a part of something.
Surgical removal of all or part of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north._Situated at or extending to the side._Surgical excision of a sector of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Situated at or extending to the side.
Surgical excision of a sector of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north._Toward the middle or inside (as opposed to lateral)._Surgical excision of a sector of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Toward the middle or inside (as opposed to lateral).
Surgical excision of a sector of the liver.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north._Denoting the front surface of the body; often used to indicate the position of one structure relative to another._Surgical excision of a sector of the liver.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.::1: Surgery to remove one half of the larynx.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
Surgery to remove one half of the larynx.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.::1: Surgery to remove one half of the larynx.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
Surgery to remove one half of the larynx.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The proximal segment of the large intestine that is located in the right side of the abdominal cavity. It includes the cecum (with the attached appendix) and the ascending colon._Having been removed by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The proximal segment of the large intestine that is located in the right side of the abdominal cavity. It includes the cecum (with the attached appendix) and the ascending colon.
Having been removed by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure involving the removal of the entire remaining lung tissue following partial lung resection.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure involving the removal of the entire remaining lung tissue following partial lung resection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the left part of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the left part of the colon.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  WZhang, 02/23/2015

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure involving the removal of the entire remaining lung tissue following partial lung resection.: Removal or excision by surgical measures.

Concepts.definition: A procedure involving the use of a wire for the localization of a usually non-palpable breast lesion that needs to be surgically removed.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: A surgical procedure involving the removal of the entire remaining lung tissue following partial lung resection.: Removal or excision by surgical measures.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
A procedure involving the use of a wire for the localization of a usually non-palpable breast lesion that needs to be surgically removed.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the stomach.: A tube used to provide nutrients to patients who can not swallow. It may be inserted through the nose or placed into the stomach through the abdominal wall.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the stomach.
A tube directed into the stomach, duodenum or jejunum from the nose, mouth or through the skin, for the purposes of delivering nutrition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the small intestine that extends from the duodenum to the ileum.: A tube used to provide nutrients to patients who can not swallow. It may be inserted through the nose or placed into the stomach through the abdominal wall.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the small intestine that extends from the duodenum to the ileum.
A tube directed into the stomach, duodenum or jejunum from the nose, mouth or through the skin, for the purposes of delivering nutrition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.: Surgery performed in morbidly obese patients to help promote weight loss. The procedure aims at the reduction of the stomach size and it is usually achieved either with the implantation of a medical device or the removal of part of the stomach.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.

Surgery performed in morbidly obese patients to help promote weight loss. The procedure aims at the reduction of the stomach size and it is usually achieved either with the implantation of a medical device or the removal of part of the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.: A therapeutic surgical procedure to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease and hiatus hernia. It involves the wrapping of the fundus of the stomach around the lower esophagus to strengthen the lower esophageal sphincter.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.

A therapeutic surgical procedure to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease and hiatus hernia. It involves the wrapping of the fundus of the stomach around the lower esophagus to strengthen the lower esophageal sphincter.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure performed in combination with abdominal surgery for cancer that has spread to the abdomen. It involves the infusion of a heated chemotherapy solution that circulates into the abdominal cavity.

Concepts.definition: A procedure performed in combination with abdominal surgery for cancer that has spread to the abdomen. It involves the infusion of a heated chemotherapy solution that circulates into the abdominal cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree or intensity or amount.: Denoting the front surface of the body; often used to indicate the position of one structure relative to another.: Removal or excision by surgical measures.

Concepts.definition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.
Denoting the front surface of the body; often used to indicate the position of one structure relative to another.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.: The part of the respiratory system between the nose or mouth and the lungs.: Removal or excision by surgical measures.

Concepts.definition: Greater or bigger in amount, extent, or size.
The part of the respiratory system between the nose or mouth and the lungs.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure involving the insertion of a plastic tube into the stomach through the nose.

Concepts.definition: A procedure involving the insertion of a plastic tube into the stomach through the nose.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A major surgical procedure involving the removal of all the contents of the pelvic cavity, including reproductive organs, bladder, rectum, and anus. It is performed for cancers of the pelvic cavity organs that have not responded to other treatment options.

Concepts.definition: A major surgical procedure involving the removal of all the contents of the pelvic cavity, including reproductive organs, bladder, rectum, and anus. It is performed for cancers of the pelvic cavity organs that have not responded to other treatment options.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Rectal; of, or pertaining to, the rectum.: The part of the large intestine between the cecum and the rectum; it extracts moisture from food residues before they are excreted.: Removal or excision by surgical measures.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the rectum.

The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure involving the partial or complete resection of the sigmoid colon.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure involving the partial or complete resection of the sigmoid colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the breast.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the breast.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure that removes the breast tissue while leaving the skin, nipple, and areola intact.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure that removes the breast tissue while leaving the skin, nipple, areola, and chest wall muscles intact.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive tube between the stomach and the cecum or beginning of the large intestine; it consists of three portions: duodenum, jejunum, and ileum. SYN intestinum tenue.: Resected; having been removed by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The section of the intestines between the pylorus and cecum. The small intestine is approximately 20 feet long and consists of the duodenum, the jejunum, and the ileum. Its main function is to absorb nutrients from food as the food is transported to the large intestine.
Having been removed by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A conservation laryngeal surgery involving the resection of the true and false vocal cords, both paraglottic spaces, and the thyroid cartilage. In some cases the preepiglottic space and the epiglottis are also removed.

Concepts.definition: A conservation laryngeal surgery involving the resection of the true and false vocal cords, both paraglottic spaces, and the thyroid cartilage. In some cases the preepiglottic space and the epiglottis are also removed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the portion of the larynx superior to the true vocal cords.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the portion of the larynx superior to the true vocal cords.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The lower opening of the digestive tract, lying in the cleft between the buttocks, through which fecal matter is extruded.: Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.: Removal or excision by surgical measures.

Concepts.definition: The terminal section of the alimentary canal, which extends from the anorectal junction and ends at the anal opening.
Of or belonging to a restricted area or locality.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An endoscopic laser microsurgical laryngeal procedure for patients with early glottis tumors.

Concepts.definition: An endoscopic laser microsurgical laryngeal procedure for patients with early glottis tumors.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical diversion of the urine flow following cystectomy or in patients with a non-functioning bladder.

Concepts.definition: Surgical diversion of the urine flow following cystectomy or in patients with a non-functioning bladder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic surgical procedure in which the anus, rectum, part of the sigmoid colon, and the regional lymph nodes are removed through abdominal and perineal incisions.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic surgical procedure in which the anus, rectum, part of the sigmoid colon, and the regional lymph nodes are removed through abdominal and perineal incisions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Excision of one or both adrenal glands. (From Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the adrenal gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic endoscopic procedure performed to remove adenomas from the ampulla of Vater. It involves the excision of the ampulla of Vater and the implantation of the common bile duct and pancreatic main duct into the wall of duodenum.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic endoscopic procedure performed to remove adenomas from the ampulla of Vater. It involves the excision of the ampulla of Vater and the implantation of the common bile duct and pancreatic main duct into the wall of duodenum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the vermiform appendix.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the vermiform appendix.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic surgical procedure involving the removal of two lobes of the right lung.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic surgical procedure involving the removal of two lobes of the right lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Non-chemotherapeutic embolization involving the injection of small particles through a catheter in the hepatic artery. It is performed to block the blood supply to liver cancer.

Concepts.definition: Non-chemotherapeutic embolization involving the injection of small particles through a catheter in the hepatic artery. It is performed to block the blood supply to liver cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic surgical procedure to remove liver cancers located at the central segment of the liver. It involves the resection of the central hepatic segment with the left and right segments remaining intact.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic surgical procedure to remove liver cancers located at the central segment of the liver. It involves the resection of the central hepatic segment with the left and right segments remaining intact.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the entire liver.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: The transference of a part of or an entire liver from one human or animal to another.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the entire liver.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
The transfer of a healthy liver allograft from a donor to a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Extension; an addition to the length of something.: (lo-BEK-toe-mee) The removal of a lobe.

Concepts.definition: To increase in length or duration.
Surgical removal of a lobe of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The space of the abdominal and pelvic cavities outside the peritoneum.: Surgical excision of one or more lymph nodes. Its most common use is in cancer surgery. (From Dorland, 28th ed, p966)

Concepts.definition: The space of the abdominal and pelvic cavities outside the peritoneum.
Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Regions near to the aorta.: Surgical excision of one or more lymph nodes. Its most common use is in cancer surgery. (From Dorland, 28th ed, p966)

Concepts.definition: Regions near to the aorta.
Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of one or more pelvic lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of one or more pelvic lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical scraping and removal of the inner lining of the uterus through direct dilation of the uterine cervix.

Concepts.definition: A surgical scraping and removal of the inner lining of the uterus through direct dilation of the uterine cervix.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Changed definition to match current NCIt. mc 4.23.19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Insertion of a thin needle or tube into the abdomen to remove fluid from the peritoneal cavity.

Concepts.definition: The removal of excess fluid via needle puncture from any body cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of excess fluid via needle puncture from the thoracic cavity.

Concepts.definition: The removal of excess fluid via needle puncture from the thoracic cavity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. mc 4.23.19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A biospecimen collection and staining procedure in which secretions and superficial cells of the cervix are collected and stained with the Papanicolaou stain followed by microscopic examination to identify the presence of abnormal cells.

Concepts.definition: A biospecimen collection and staining procedure in which secretions and superficial cells of the cervix are collected and stained with the Papanicolaou stain followed by microscopic examination to identify the presence of abnormal cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove the entire vulva (the external female genital organs, including the clitoris, vaginal lips, and the opening to the vagina) and nearby lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to remove the entire vulva (the external female genital organs, including the clitoris, vaginal lips, and the opening to the vagina) and nearby lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove an affected area of the vulva (the external female genital organs, including the clitoris, vaginal lips, and the opening to the vagina) along with a small amount of surrounding normal tissue.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to remove an affected area of the vulva (the external female genital organs, including the clitoris, vaginal lips, and the opening to the vagina) along with a small amount of surrounding normal tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An X-ray procedure using multiple coordinates to precisely determine the location of a tumor or nodule so as to obtain a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A biopsy procedure that uses 3-dimensional imaging to localize a lesion and guide the removal of a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added OBIB alternate name and identifier - DW 03-21-2019

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body and cervix, via the vaginal approach.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body and cervix, via the vaginal approach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that collects a component of the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that collects a component of the peripheral blood while returning the rest to the donor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An invasive procedure in which a hollow needle is introduced through an intervertebral space in the lower back to access the subarachnoid space in order to sample cerebrospinal fluid or to administer medication.

Concepts.definition: An invasive procedure in which a hollow needle is introduced through an intervertebral space in the lower back to access the subarachnoid space in order to sample cerebrospinal fluid or to administer medication.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Procedure using suction, usually with a thin needle and syringe, to removal bodily fluid or tissue.

Concepts.definition: Procedure using suction, usually with a thin needle and syringe, to remove bodily fluid or tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A reconstructive surgical procedure involving the anastomosis of the hepatic duct to the jejunum.

Concepts.definition: A reconstructive surgical procedure involving the anastomosis of the hepatic duct to the jejunum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A plastic, dome-shaped device, with a catheter attached to the underside used to deliver chemotherapy to the central nervous system.

Concepts.definition: A plastic, dome-shaped device, with a catheter attached to the underside used to deliver chemotherapy to the central nervous system.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
